content.description: Stand start on decent small crimps. Stand to a slanted rail just below the lip, and mantel straight up. A sit start is possible if dry.
content.location: This is on the right side of the wall just to the right of Thrush.

content.description: Stand start matched on a great slanted edge. Stand up to a crimp and the drill hole. Mantle the top out. SDS V3
content.location: On the right side of the wall, you’ll find the start hold in the middle of the slab.

content.description: Sit start at the two distinct lines on the face. Climb straight up to a tricky mantel.
content.location: On the left side of the wall, look for two lines on the face.

content.description: Sit start on the right side of the wall with your hands on blocky features. Fire up for a good chockstone, and traverse left onto the face, using the block for feet. Make the mantel topout, and it's over.
content.location: Start on the far right side of the left wall with your hands on blocky features. See the photo.

content.description: Sit start on a good incut with a divot in it and another incut. The right hold might be reachy for shorter people. Head straight up on friendly holds. Mantel the topout. The rock is bullet, red granite.
content.location: This is on the left side of the weeping wall to the left of the two drill holes.

content.description: Unfortunately it has to be super dry to climb here, maybe in a drought year. There is water constantly weeping down this really nice slab of bullet granite. It is worth a peek if you’re climbing at the main wall, but be prepared to be disappointed.
